economy

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • economy.Inventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<Item,java.lang.Long>>

    public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<Item,java.lang.Long>>
    A data structure that represents a collection of items with varying quantities.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory()
      Creates a new empty inventory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean contains(Item item)
      Returns true if and only if the current item has a positive quantity in the current inventory.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns true if and only if the current inventory is "equal" to the given object.
      java.util.List<Item> getItems()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of items in the current inventory.
      long getQuantity(Item item)
      Returns the quantity of a given item existing in the current inventory.
      Item getRandomItem()
      Returns a randomly selected item from the current inventory, or null if the current inventory is empty.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hashcode for the current inventory using the current inventory's items.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if and only if there are no items in the current inventory.
      java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<Item,java.lang.Long>> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the entries of type Map.Entry representing items and quantities in the current inventory.

      Removes a given item of a given quantity from the current inventory.
      long size()
      Returns the number of unique items in the current inventory.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the current inventory of the form: QTY1x"ITEM1", QTY2x"ITEM2", QTY3x"ITEM3", ..., QTYnx"ITEMn" where QTYk is the quantity of ITEMk which is the kth item in the current inventory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Creates a new empty inventory.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Item item,
                long quantity)
        Adds a given item of a given quantity to the current inventory. If the given quantity is not positive, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to add to the current inventory.
        quantity - The quantity to add to the current inventory.

      • remove

        public void remove(Item item,
                   long quantity)
        Removes a given item of a given quantity from the current inventory. If the given quantity is not positive, nothing happens. If the given quantity to remove is greater than the current quantity of the item existing in the current inventory, then the item entry is removed from the inventory altogether (rather than the current inventory reporting a negative quantity of the item).
        Parameters:
        item - The item to remove from the current inventory.
        quantity - The quantity to remove from the current inventory.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Item item)
        Returns true if and only if the current item has a positive quantity in the current inventory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to check.
        Returns:
        true if the current item has a positive quantity in the current inventory; false otherwise.

      • getQuantity

        public long getQuantity(Item item)
        Returns the quantity of a given item existing in the current inventory. Returns 0 if the given item does not exist in the current inventory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to get the quantity of.
        Returns:
        The quantity of a given item existing in the current inventory, or 0 if the given item does not exist in the current inventory.

      • size

        public long size()
        Returns the number of unique items in the current inventory.
        Returns:
        The number of unique items in the current inventory.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if and only if there are no items in the current inventory.
        Returns:
        True if there are no items in the current inventory; false otherwise.

      • getRandomItem

        public Item getRandomItem()
        Returns a randomly selected item from the current inventory, or null if the current inventory is empty.
        Returns:
        A randomly selected item from the current inventory, or null if the current inventory is empty.

      • getItems

        public java.util.List<Item> getItems()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of items in the current inventory.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable view of the list of items in the current inventory.

      • add

        public void add(Inventory other)
        Adds another inventory to this one. That is, this inventory receives each item from the other inventory. This does not change the other inventory.
        Parameters:
        other - The other inventory.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<Item,java.lang.Long>> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the entries of type Map.Entry representing items and quantities in the current inventory.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<Item,java.lang.Long>>
        Returns:
        an iterator over the entries of type Map.Entry representing items and quantities in the current inventory.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the current inventory of the form:
        QTY1x"ITEM1", QTY2x"ITEM2", QTY3x"ITEM3", ..., QTYnx"ITEMn"
        where QTYk is the quantity of ITEMk which is the kth item in the current inventory. Returns "no items" if the current inventory is empty.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the current inventory.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if and only if the current inventory is "equal" to the given object. That is,
        • The given object is of type Inventory,
        • The given other inventory has items equal to the current inventory's items.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The other object to test equality against this inventory.
        Returns:
        True if this inventory is equal to the other object; false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashcode for the current inventory using the current inventory's items.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A hashcode for the current inventory using the current inventory's items.
